posts.post_content:
in spite of JL\_Weber's excellent point, it still gets limited because it searches for [Gush](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gush ) (Essentialy 1B for 2 cards) and [Ancestral Recall](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ancestral Recall ) (1BB for 3 cards)
  
   
If not for those cards, [Merchant scroll](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Merchant scroll) would be exactly what it seems, a "Meh" tutor.
posts.html:
in spite of JL_Weber's excellent point, it still gets limited because it searches for Gush (Essentialy 1B for 2 cards) and Ancestral Recall (1BB for 3 cards)

If not for those cards, Merchant scroll would be exactly what it seems, a "Meh" tutor.

Posted By: A3Kitsune (2/6/2010 6:40:11 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
[Ancestral Recall](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ancestral Recall) and [Gush](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gush) may give you card advantage, it but [Gifts Ungiven](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gifts Ungiven) wins the game.  
Blue control was so dominnat because [mana drain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=mana drain) decks counter a juicy target, and use this and Gifts as a mana sink.
posts.html:
Ancestral Recall and Gush may give you card advantage, it but Gifts Ungiven wins the game.

Posted By: zk3 (5/11/2011 8:42:55 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I'm not sure if JL\_Weber is serious or just a total moron. If he's just being sarcastic then he's awesome however.   
  
This card is making me second guess the mystical tutors I've been using in casual. The lack of card-disadvantage; the fact I'm always searching for either High Tide, Frantic Search, or Snap; and the fact that this isn't vulnerable to milling might make up for it being a sorcery instead. Mystical Tutor HAS to be instant to be worth anything at all as otherwise milling strategies, even terrible ones, could easily counter it.  
  
@mr8658  
I didn't realize lightning bolt was blue...

posts.post_content: If you're ahead and want to lock your opponent out of the game, simply get one of your [Cryptic Command](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cryptic Command)s or whatever and stay ahead. I could write on for an hour about the potential targets for this, but I'll just settle with counterspells off my head. Also note that it doesn't just search mono colored spells, so you can also go and get [Slave of Bolas](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Slave of Bolas) or [Conflux](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Conflux) if that's what you need.
posts.html:
If you're ahead and want to lock your opponent out of the game, simply get one of your Cryptic Commands or whatever and stay ahead. I could write on for an hour about the potential targets for this, but I'll just settle with counterspells off my head. Also note that it doesn't just search mono colored spells, so you can also go and get Slave of Bolas or Conflux if that's what you need.

posts.post_content: I know this should be considered worse than [Mystical Tutor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mystical Tutor), but getting it into your hand is a huge bonus... enough to justify the extra mana I think, and *almost* enough to make up for not being able to hit sorceries.

posts.post_content:
.5/5 It only searches for **Blue Instants**, which means you either get a [Counterspell](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Counterspell), [Unsummon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Unsummon), or [Inspiration](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Inspiration) and of course the hundreds of other variants on those card.   
  
So take the card your gonna pick, add one blue and one colorless mana to it, do you still want to play it? I wouldn't. I'll take a [Traumatic Visions](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Traumatic Visions) (not a good card) in any non-monoblue deck any day and a [Flow of Ideas](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Flow of Ideas) in a monoblue deck.
posts.html:
